column2: This AmpC beta-lactamase gene is frequently found on plasmids that can move between Enterobacterales, sometimes within integrons or IS-associated contexts. It is often discussed in food-associated E. coli and Salmonella (including poultry- or retail-meat linked isolates) as well as in human infections.

This AmpC beta-lactamase gene is frequently found on plasmids that can move between Enterobacterales, sometimes within integrons or IS-associated contexts. It is often discussed in food-associated E. coli and Salmonella (including poultry- or retail-meat linked isolates) as well as in human infections.

This beta-lactamase determinant is commonly associated with transferable plasmids in Gram-negative bacteria, and many reports describe it embedded in transposons or integron-linked regions that facilitate spread. It has been documented in Enterobacterales that include food-borne pathogens and food-associated commensals, supporting a role for the food chain as a reservoir or conduit. Canadian case series and surveillance reports have described related isolates carrying this determinant in healthcare and, in some instances, agri-food contexts.

This folate-pathway resistance determinant is commonly found in class 1 integrons and on multi-resistance plasmids in Enterobacterales. It is frequently described in food-borne pathogens such as Salmonella and Shiga-toxin–producing or commensal E. coli from food animals and retail meats.

Canadian case series and surveillance reports have described related isolates carrying this determinant in healthcare and, in some instances, agri-food contexts.

This colistin-resistance gene is frequently carried on transferable Enterobacterales plasmids, often alongside insertion sequences that help it mobilize between strains. It has been reported from food-related settings (especially E. coli and Salmonella from meat or retail foods) in multiple countries, and Canadian surveillance studies have also detected it in clinical and/or agri-food isolates.

This aminoglycoside resistance determinant is commonly carried on plasmids or within integrons, and transposon- or IS-mediated mobility is often described for its genetic neighborhood. It has been reported in food-borne pathogens (notably Salmonella and E. coli from meat, poultry, or produce-associated investigations) as well as in clinical isolates.

This macrolide-lincosamide-streptogramin resistance determinant is often located on plasmids or conjugative elements, with transposons or insertion sequences commonly reported in the surrounding genetic context. It is described in food-associated Gram-positive bacteria and zoonotic/food-borne pathogens (for example, enterococci and streptococci) as well as in clinical isolates. Canadian studies have reported related resistant lineages in both human and animal or retail-food sampling, indicating potential cross-reservoir transmission.

This ESBL gene is commonly plasmid-borne in Enterobacterales, with mobile elements such as ISEcp1 or IS26 often implicated in its movement. It is repeatedly described in food-borne and food-associated bacteria (notably E. coli and Salmonella) as well as in human infections, suggesting exchange between reservoirs.

This macrolide-lincosamide-streptogramin resistance determinant is often located on plasmids or conjugative elements, with transposons or insertion sequences commonly reported in the surrounding genetic context. It is described in food-associated Gram-positive bacteria and zoonotic/food-borne pathogens (for example, enterococci and streptococci) as well as in clinical isolates. Canadian studies have reported related resistant lineages in both human and animal or retail-food sampling, indicating potential cross-reservoir transmission.

This fluoroquinolone resistance determinant is often linked to transferable plasmids and may co-occur with other resistance genes in integron-rich regions. It is reported in food-associated Enterobacterales (including poultry- or beef-linked E. coli and Salmonella) and in human clinical infections, indicating movement between reservoirs.
